In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's how you could write this function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " " => "_"), "-" => "_")
end
```

This function firstly strips any leading or trailing whitespaces from the column name using `strip`. Then it converts all characters to lowercase with `lowercase`. Afterwards, it replaces all spaces and hyphens in the cleaned column name string with underscores, using `replace` with `" "` replaced by `"_"` and `"-" => "_"`.

You can test this function with an example as follows:

```julia
println(clean_column("My Column"))  # Outputs "my_column"
```
